documentation.text: pass in the oracle contract so that it can pull info from it
this sets the treasury, and oracle

@dev this function will get the exchagne rate for the token being exchanged for cblt token
 it will call on the oracle to make the calculation. the returnAmount is going to be a factor
 of three larger than the actual amount which means the returnAmount will need to be divided by
 1000 to get the correct amount that will be swapped

attributes.text:
@dev this function will check to see if the both tokens are correct when wanting
 to make the exchange with chromium

getCbltExchangeRate(address,address,uint.details: this function will get the exchagne rate for the token being exchanged for cblt token it will call on the oracle to make the calculation. the returnAmount is going to be a factor of three larger than the actual amount which means the returnAmount will need to be divided by 1000 to get the correct amount that will be swapped

params.destToken: (IERC20) Address of token or `address(0)` for Ether
params.distribution: (uint256[]) Array of weights for volume distribution returned by `getExpectedReturn`
params.flags: (uint256) Flags for enabling and disabling some features, default 0
params.fromToken: (IERC20) Address of token or `address(0)` for Ether
params.minReturn: (uint256) Minimum expected return, returned by getExpectedReturn

swapForCblt(address,address,uint256,uint.details: this function will swap cblt tokens for tokens that are allowed in the bank it calls on a function inside of the bank to do the exchange since no tokens are going to be held in the exchange

constructor.notice: pass in the oracle contract so that it can pull info from it

setOracle(address).notice: this sets the treasury, and oracle
